Gifted with extraordinary telepathic powers, she has uncovered a secret that threatens the political stability of the universe - and the ruling forces will stop at nothing to ensure it stays buried. Sci-fi adventure based on the TV series Firefly, starring Nathan Fillion, Summer Glau and Chiwetel Ejiofor.

programme.title: Hostel
programme.desc: Three backpackers travelling across Europe hear of a Slovakian inn where their every hedonistic desire will be met. However, they discover they have been lured into the clutches of wealthy depraved businessmen who pay for the chance to torture people to death. Horror, starring Jay Hernandez, Derek Richardson and Eythor Gudjonsson.(n)

programme.title: Rosemary's Baby
programme.desc: A couple move into a new apartment, and the husband forms a close friendship with their elderly neighbours. The wife soon becomes pregnant, and starts to suspect her spouse has been seduced into a Satanic cult, who have sinister plans for her baby. Roman Polanski's horror, based on the novel by Ira Levin, and starring Mia Farrow, John Cassavetes, Oscar-winner Ruth Gordon, Sidney Blackmer and Ralph Bellamy.(n)

programme.title: Ghostbusters: Special
programme.desc: The making of the long-awaited horror comedy sequel, including interviews with Melissa McCarthy and the rest of the cast.(n)

programme.title: Journey to the Center of the Earth
programme.desc: An explorer discovers a prehistoric monster-infested world deep beneath Earth's crust and faces a tough ordeal escaping the predatory attacks of the creatures as he tries to guide his team back to safety. Sci-fi adventure based on Jules Verne's novel, starring Pat Boone, James Mason, Arlene Dahl and Diane Baker.(n)

programme.title: E.T.: The Extra-Terrestrial
programme.desc: A lonely boy befriends an alien who has been left stranded on Earth. The two develop a psychic connection as the boy helps the extraterrestrial to contact his own people and call for rescue. However, living on Earth starts to have a devastating effect on the visitor's health, and a government operative is determined to capture him for study. Steven Spielberg's sci-fi fantasy, starring Henry Thomas, Drew Barrymore, Dee Wallace and Peter Coyote.(n)

programme.title: Ghostbusters: Special
programme.desc: The making of the long-awaited horror comedy sequel, including interviews with Melissa McCarthy and the rest of the cast.(n)

programme.title: Self/less
programme.desc: A wealthy old man dying of cancer arranges to have his consciousness transplanted into a younger body. The procedure is a success, but he begins to have suspicions about where his new body came from - only to find that the company behind the process will kill to protect their dark secrets. Sci-fi thriller, starring Ryan Reynolds and Ben Kingsley.(n)

programme.title: The Chronicles of Riddick
programme.desc: Fugitive Riddick evades capture by bounty hunters and steals their spacecraft, only to run into an even bigger threat - fanatical cult members on a sinister mission to kill or convert anyone who crosses their path as they seek galactic domination. Sci-fi adventure sequel, with Vin Diesel reprising his role from Pitch Black alongside Judi Dench, Alexa Davalos and Thandie Newton.(n)

programme.title: The Terminator
programme.desc: A cyborg assassin is sent on a murderous mission back in time to the 20th century, where he wreaks havoc while searching for his intended victim - a woman whose unborn son is destined to lead the human race in a war against machines. However, a soldier has also been sent from the future to protect her. James Cameron's sci-fi thriller, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Linda Hamilton and Michael Biehn.(n)

programme.title: E.T.: The Extra-Terrestrial
programme.desc: A lonely boy befriends an alien who has been left stranded on Earth. The two develop a psychic connection as the boy helps the extraterrestrial to contact his own people and call for rescue. However, living on Earth starts to have a devastating effect on the visitor's health, and a government operative is determined to capture him for study. Steven Spielberg's sci-fi fantasy, starring Henry Thomas, Drew Barrymore, Dee Wallace and Peter Coyote.(n)

programme.title: Self/less
programme.desc: A wealthy old man dying of cancer arranges to have his consciousness transplanted into a younger body. The procedure is a success, but he begins to have suspicions about where his new body came from - only to find that the company behind the process will kill to protect their dark secrets. Sci-fi thriller, starring Ryan Reynolds and Ben Kingsley.(n)

programme.title: The Chronicles of Riddick
programme.desc: Fugitive Riddick evades capture by bounty hunters and steals their spacecraft, only to run into an even bigger threat - fanatical cult members on a sinister mission to kill or convert anyone who crosses their path as they seek galactic domination. Sci-fi adventure sequel, with Vin Diesel reprising his role from Pitch Black alongside Judi Dench, Alexa Davalos and Thandie Newton.(n)

programme.title: The Terminator
programme.desc: A cyborg assassin is sent on a murderous mission back in time to the 20th century, where he wreaks havoc while searching for his intended victim - a woman whose unborn son is destined to lead the human race in a war against machines. However, a soldier has also been sent from the future to protect her. James Cameron's sci-fi thriller, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Linda Hamilton and Michael Biehn.(n)

programme.title: The Birds
programme.desc: A San Francisco socialite takes a shine to a man she meets by chance, and follows him home to a Californian coastal community. Her arrival coincides with a series of mysterious attacks on people by birds, which soon escalates as vast flocks go on the warpath. Alfred Hitchcock's thriller, based on a Daphne du Maurier short story, starring Tippi Hedren, Rod Taylor, Suzanne Pleshette, Jessica Tandy and Veronica Cartwright.

programme.title: Thunderbolt and Lightfoot
programme.desc: Retired bank robber John Doherty escapes a gunman with the aid of a young car thief, and together they go in search of the loot from the former crook's last job. When they discover the stash is missing - and John's thuggish old partners are also looking for it - the pair decide to do a repeat robbery. Comedy drama, starring Clint Eastwood, Jeff Bridges, George Kennedy and Geoffrey Lewis.

programme.title: Rawhide
programme.desc: Outlaws hold staff and a passenger and her baby hostage at a remote stagecoach station while awaiting the arrival of a shipment of $100,000 in gold bullion. The nervous captives try to stay calm, but the tension between the gang leader and a jumpy henchman grows fraught, ending in a frantic shoot-out - with the infant in the thick of the fray. Western, starring Tyrone Power, Susan Hayward and Jack Elam.

programme.title: Charlie Wilson's War
programme.desc: A US congressman gets embroiled in a secret mission to provide covert military support to rebels in Soviet-occupied Afghanistan. Before long, he finds unlikely allies in the shape of a womanising CIA agent, a Texan socialite and the president of Pakistan. Fact-based political drama set during the 1980s, starring Tom Hanks, Julia Roberts and Philip Seymour Hoffman.

programme.title: True Story
programme.desc: A disgraced New York Times reporter discovers that an accused killer has assumed his identity, and the resulting investigation turns into a game of cat and mouse. Fact-based drama, starring Jonah Hill, James Franco and Felicity Jones.

programme.title: Beyond the Sea
programme.desc: Musical biopic of singer Bobby Darin, exploring his formative years, during which he develops his love of music, his subsequent success as a rock 'n' roller and a lounge singer, and his struggle to maintain popularity during the 1960s. Kevin Spacey directs and stars, alongside Bob Hoskins, John Goodman and Kate Bosworth.

programme.title: Get On Up
programme.desc: Biopic of James Brown, examining key moments in the soul singer's life, from his impoverished childhood in South Carolina to his rise to become one of the most influential figures in music history, and following his intense friendship with fellow singer Bobby Byrd. Starring Chadwick Boseman, Viola Davis, Nelsan Ellis and Octavia Spencer.

programme.title: Amadeus: The Director's Cut
programme.desc: Composer Antonio Salieri is a favoured artist in the court of Austrian emperor Joseph II, but he finds himself pushed aside in favour of a young Mozart. Salieri admires the younger maestro's music, but is incensed that someone so vulgar and obnoxious should be gifted with such talent, and as jealousy consumes him, he plots his rival's downfall. Extended cut of Milos Forman's period drama, adapted by Peter Shaffer from his own play and starring F Murray Abraham and Tom Hulce.

programme.title: Love & Mercy
programme.desc: Biopic of the Beach Boys' Brian Wilson, following the singer-songwriter at two periods in his life. In the 1960s, he is at his creative peak, but haunted by inner demons that take their toll on his mental health. By the 1980s, he is a broken man dominated by a shady doctor, until a new relationship offers him a chance at recovery. Starring John Cusack, Paul Dano, Paul Giamatti and Elizabeth Banks.

programme.title: Straight Outta Compton
programme.desc: Biopic of hip hop group NWA, examining their rise to fame in the 1980s. The five members of the group drew inspiration from their anger at the dangerous world they saw around them, producing hard-hitting songs about urban life that redefined a musical genre. Starring O'Shea Jackson Jr, Corey Hawkins, Jason Mitchell, Neil Brown Jr and Aldis Hodge.

programme.title: The Commitments
programme.desc: A would-be music producer from Dublin believes he can make it big in Ireland by promoting a top-rate soul band, so he trawls a working-class neighbourhood and auditions unlikely singers and musicians to put together as a group. Alan Parker's urban comedy, based on the novel by Roddy Doyle, starring Robert Arkins, Andrew Strong, Michael Aherne, Angeline Ball and Maria Doyle Kennedy.

programme.title: Training Day
programme.desc: A cop embarks on his first day in narcotics, partnering a seasoned officer whose willingness to flout the rules forces him to question everything he has learnt. As they resort to extreme measures to crack a case, the rookie is left battling his conscience in a dangerous situation. Thriller, starring Denzel Washington, Ethan Hawke, Scott Glenn and Tom Berenger.(n)

programme.title: The Face of an Angel
programme.desc: A journalist and a documentary-maker become obsessed with the murder case they are covering. Fact-based drama inspired by Amanda Knox's case and the death of Meredith Kercher in 2007, starring Daniel Bruhl, Kate Beckinsale and Cara Delevingne.(n)

programme.title: Fur: An Imaginary Portrait of Diane Arbus
programme.desc: Fictionalised biopic imagining the events that inspired the photographer's unusual art. Bored with her marriage and work as her husband's assistant on fashion shoots, she becomes fascinated with her mysterious neighbour, a former sideshow performer who has excessive body hair. Starring Nicole Kidman, Robert Downey Jr and Ty Burrell.(n)

programme.title: The New World
programme.desc: A 17th-century English settler in America falls in love with a native princess, but as conflict erupts between their people he is forced to abandon her. She is converted to Christianity, adopting European culture and forming a romance with a tobacco planter, but remains torn between two worlds. Terrence Malick's epic historical drama, starring Colin Farrell, Q'orianka Kilcher, Christian Bale and Christopher Plummer.(n)

programme.title: Who's That Knocking at My Door
programme.desc: Harvey Keitel plays a tough Italian-American who prefers hanging out with a rough and ready street gang to spending time with his increasingly frustrated girlfriend. Urban crime story, with Zina Bethune and Anne Colette.(n)

programme.title: Dangerous Liaisons
programme.desc: A philandering aristocrat in 18th-century France schemes with his manipulative former lover to seduce a virtuous young woman. As their conspiracy becomes ever more tangled, events take an unexpected turn. Stephen Frears' Oscar-winning drama of sexual politics, based on Pierre Choderlos de Laclos' novel, starring John Malkovich, Glenn Close, Michelle Pfeiffer, Swoosie Kurtz, Uma Thurman and Keanu Reeves.(n)

programme.title: A Fistful of Dollars
programme.desc: A mysterious gunslinger rides into a town on the Mexican border divided by two warring families. After killing the henchmen of one clan, he seems to have made it clear where his loyalties lie and is hired by their rivals. However, he is secretly planning to play them off against each other to his own advantage. Sergio Leone's Western, with Clint Eastwood making his first appearance as The Man with No Name alongside Gian Maria Volonte and Marianne Koch.(n)

programme.title: Flags of Our Fathers
programme.desc: The stories of three of the men in the famous photograph of US servicemen raising their flag on the island of Iwo Jima. After returning home from the battlefield, the veterans grapple with an increasing sense of survivor guilt as they struggle to adjust to everyday life. Clint Eastwood's Second World War drama, starring Adam Beach, Ryan Phillippe, Jesse Bradford, Jamie Bell and Paul Walker.(n)

programme.title: Magic in the Moonlight
programme.desc: An English magician who exposes fake psychics is approached by his friend to prove that a medium is a fraud exploiting a wealthy family. As he watches the spiritualist at work, he begins to believe that she is the genuine article, challenging his previously unshakeable scepticism. Woody Allen's 1920s-set romantic comedy, with Colin Firth and Emma Stone.(n)

programme.title: Irrational Man
programme.desc: A troubled philosophy professor begins teaching at a small town college, but struggles to find any meaning in his life. He finds some measure of happiness in his friendship with a student, and when they overhear a stranger's conversation, it spurs the tortured academic on to a course of action that changes everything. Woody Allen's drama, starring Joaquin Phoenix, Emma Stone and Parker Posey.(n)

programme.title: Internal Affairs
programme.desc: A crooked cop uses his badge and uniform as a cover for his unsavoury money-making schemes and is prepared to murder anyone who stands in his way. A zealous investigator vows to bring him to justice, but the cunning detective responds by turning his adversary's wife against him. Crime thriller, starring Richard Gere, Andy Garcia, Laurie Metcalf, Nancy Travis and William Baldwin.(n)

programme.title: The Squad
programme.desc: Contact is lost with a remote military base in Colombia's high-plains moors. Nine soldiers are sent to investigate, finding the outpost deserted except for a captive woman who does not speak. The isolation and the sinister surroundings spread paranoia among the men, who begin to turn against each other. Horror, starring Juan David Restrepo and Andres Castaneda. In Spanish.

programme.title: The Bedford Incident
programme.desc: The ruthless captain of a US destroyer develops an obsession with tracking down a Russian submarine. As he drives his men harder, he fails to anticipate the consequences of his actions - leading to a fatal mistake. Cold War thriller, starring Richard Widmark, Sidney Poitier, Martin Balsam, Wally Cox, Eric Portman and Donald Sutherland.

programme.title: Ice Age: Dawn of the Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Sid the sloth discovers three eggs - but when they hatch into dinosaurs, he struggles to keep them under control. The creatures' mother comes looking for her offspring and takes them and Sid to an underground world where the giant reptiles never became extinct. Sid's friends, aided by a crazed one-eyed weasel, head for this strange new land to rescue him. Animated adventure sequel, with the voices of John Leguizamo, Denis Leary, Ray Romano and Simon Pegg.

programme.title: Ice Age: Continental Drift
programme.desc: A cataclysm leaves prehistoric animals Manny, Sid and Diego lost at sea on a drifting iceberg. They try to find a way to return home, embarking on a journey that leads to an encounter with a ferocious band of piratical creatures. Animated comedy sequel, with the voices of Ray Romano, John Leguizamo, Denis Leary and Peter Dinklage.

programme.title: Imagine That
programme.desc: A financial executive finds his once successful career beginning to fall apart. He finds solutions to his problems when he enters the imaginary world created by his daughter - but the experience also makes him rethink whether the benefits of his job outweigh the drawbacks. Fantasy comedy, with Eddie Murphy, Yara Shahidi, Thomas Haden Church and Martin Sheen.

programme.title: St Trinian's 2: The Legend of Fritton's Gold
programme.desc: The mischievous schoolgirls embark on a hunt for buried treasure after learning their headmistress Miss Fritton is a descendant of pirates. However, they face competition in the form of a dastardly lord eager to locate the loot for himself. Comedy sequel, starring Rupert Everett, Gemma Arterton, Colin Firth, David Tennant and Talulah Riley.

programme.title: Identity Thief
programme.desc: A con-woman acquires an executive's credit card numbers, and lives a life of luxury at his expense. The outraged victim sets out on a mission to track down the fraudster and bring her to justice personally - resulting in them travelling on a disastrous road trip across America together. Comedy, with Jason Bateman, Melissa McCarthy, Jon Favreau and Amanda Peet.

programme.title: Mindscape
programme.desc: A psychic with the ability to explore people's memories uses his talents to aid the police, until a case goes disastrously wrong. Desperate for work, he agrees to help a wealthy couple discover why their teenage daughter is on a hunger strike, but beings to fear she is manipulating her memories to deceive him. Fantasy thriller, starring Mark Strong, Taissa Farmiga and Brian Cox.

programme.title: Like Someone in Love
programme.desc: A Tokyo student relies on prostitution to support herself. She is pressured by her pimp into visiting an elderly widower, but is surprised to find he only wants to talk to her. A close connection forms between them, which leads to her secret double life coming to light. Abbas Kiarostami's drama, starring Rin Takanashi and Tadashi Okuno. In Japanese.(n)

programme.title: Sands of Iwo Jima
programme.desc: A tough, embittered US marine sergeant sets out to mould a group of raw recruits into men fit for action against the Japanese in the Pacific during the Second World War. Although his training methods are often brutal, his controversial approach looks set to pay dividends when they finally see real combat. Adventure, starring John Wayne, John Agar, Adele Mara and Forrest Tucker.(n)

programme.title: Apache Territory
programme.desc: A drifter takes the lone survivor of a massacred party of settlers to an oasis, where he finds several other homesteaders and a military force have also sought shelter. They come under siege by a war party of Apaches, and face a struggle for survival - but an impending storm inspires a daring escape plan. Western, starring Rory Calhoun and Barbara Bates.(n)

programme.title: Safari
programme.desc: Wealthy eccentric Sir Vincent Brampton arrives in Nairobi intent on hunting a legendary man-eating lion, and employs the services of disgraced big-game hunter Ken Duffield, who decides to use the expedition as an opportunity to settle an old score with the ruthless Kenyan terrorist who murdered his son. Adventure set during the Mau Mau Uprising in Kenya, starring Victor Mature, Roland Culver and Earl Cameron.(n)

programme.title: Stagecoach
programme.desc: A group of strangers, including a drunken doctor, a pregnant army officer's wife and an embezzling bank clerk, embarks on a dangerous journey across hostile territory. They are joined by an outlaw, falsely accused of murder, who helps them when a Sioux war party attacks. Remake of John Ford's Western, with Bing Crosby and Ann-Margret.(n)

programme.title: Multiplicity
programme.desc: A workaholic whose demanding job often keeps him away from home hits on the idea of cloning himself so he can spend more time with his wife and kids. However, this is when his problems really begin, as the clones start to take over his house. Comedy, starring Michael Keaton, Andie MacDowell, Harris Yulin and Richard Masur.(n)

programme.title: RoboCop
programme.desc: A corporation that creates military robots seizes a chance to diversify into law enforcement when a Detroit cop is critically injured in a bombing. He is rebuilt as a crime-fighting cyborg, but struggles to regain his free will from his creators' control. Sci-fi thriller remake, starring Joel Kinnaman, Gary Oldman, Michael Keaton and Samuel L Jackson.(n)

programme.title: Les Combattants
programme.desc: Premiere. A directionless man facing an uncertain future meets a woman who believes that civilisation is doomed to fall apart very soon. He follows her to an army boot camp, where she is hoping to learn survival skills, and romance blossoms as they struggle with the hardships of their training. Romantic drama, starring Adele Haenel and Kevin Azais. In French.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Erin turns down her boyfriend's marriage proposal, so he enlists in the army.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mary Ellen prepares to give birth, and Jason encounters financial difficulties that force him to look for work elsewhere.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Laura holds Doc Baker responsible for her son's death, causing the rest of the town to reject him.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Sarah Carter is jealous when her son Jason makes friends with lonely newcomer Ruthy Leland. Vera Miles guest stars.

programme.title: A Father's Betrayal
programme.desc: A respected senior attorney faces accusations of rape against a friend of his son, who is also a lawyer, leading to professional and personal conflicts in the family as his nearest and dearest are caught up in the controversial case. Drama, directed by and starring Brian Dennehy, with Lynn Redgrave, Reed Diamond, Alice Krige and Michael David Simms.

programme.title: Chasing Secrets
programme.desc: An abused youngster suffers at the hands of her uncaring grandparents, until she is taken under the wing of an elderly couple - who struggle to help her lay the ghosts of the past to rest. Drama, starring Della Reese, Ossie Davis and Crystal Bernhard.

programme.title: Video Voyeur: The Susan Wilson Story
programme.desc: A woman is understandably horrified to discover her apparently kind-hearted neighbour has somehow managed to install state-of-the-art surveillance equipment throughout her home, so he can spy on her and her family. Fact-based drama, starring Angie Harmon, Jamey Sheridan and Dale Midkiff.

programme.title: The Babysitter's Seduction
programme.desc: When the wife of her wealthy employer is found dead, unsuspecting babysitter Michelle is drawn into a sinister plot and finds herself being accused of murder by a determined detective. Thriller, starring Keri Russell, Stephen Collins, Phylicia Rashad and Tobin Bell.

programme.title: Meat Loaf: To Hell and Back
programme.desc: Biopic charting the rocker's early years and how he overcame his bullying father and a lifelong weight problem to achieve international fame. W Earl Brown, Dedee Pfeiffer and Zachary Throne star.

programme.title: Blue Valley Songbird
programme.desc: A talented singer-songwriter's love of country music provides her with a means of escaping the clutches of her abusive manager-boyfriend and starting a new life. Drama, starring Dolly Parton, John Terry, Billy Dean and Kimberley Kates.

programme.title: In His Life: The John Lennon Story
programme.desc: Biopic of the singer who formed one half of the most successful and celebrated songwriting partnership of modern times. The film charts the musician's youth in Liverpool and his rise to fame with the Beatles, a group which redefined popular music during the 1960s, before recalling his solo career and tragic death outside his home in Manhattan. Starring Philip McQuillan, Blair Brown, Daniel McGowan and Jamie Glover.

programme.title: Birth of the Beatles
programme.desc: Pop biopic charting the Beatles' early days in Germany with original members Pete Best and Stu Sutcliffe, and their first stab at chart success with Ringo Starr and producer George Martin. Starring Stephen Mackenna, John Altman, Rod Culbertson, Ray Ashcroft and Nigel Havers.

programme.title: Hendrix
programme.desc: Biopic of the legendary guitarist who changed the face of music during the 1960s. Starring Wood Harris, Vivica A Fox, Dorian Harewood and Billy Zane.

programme.title: In the Line of Duty: Street War
programme.desc: A cop is left devastated and grief-stricken after his partner is murdered in cold blood - and sets out to exact revenge on the villains responsible for the crime. Thriller, starring Ray Sharkey, Peter Boyle and Courtney B Vance.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mary Ellen's baby is kidnapped by a girl traumatised by the loss of her own child.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Curtis is called up to serve in the medical corps in the Second World War as news reaches the town that a local man has been killed on the front line.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Willie Oleson's parents are shocked when their son announces he is planning to get married.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Isaiah makes a promise to a dying man that he will find a home for his little girl, only to realise the infant is a baby orang-utan which wreaks havoc in Walnut Grove. Meanwhile, Willie is finally ready to graduate and propose to his girlfriend, but struggles to find the courage to tell his parents that he does not want to attend college.(n)

programme.title: Romance on the Orient Express
programme.desc: An American travelling by train from Venice to Paris bumps into her former lover, and the pair try to understand why their initial romance ended so abruptly. Romantic drama, starring Cheryl Ladd and Stuart Wilson.(n)

programme.title: Moonlight & Mistletoe
programme.desc: A businesswoman returns home to help out her Dad's business Santaland after he suffers an injury. Despite her initial reluctance, she soon comes to appreciate the family trade. Drama, starring Candace Cameron Bure, Tom Arnold, Christopher Wiehl and Barbara Niven.(n)

programme.title: Prophet of Evil: The Ervil LeBaron Story
programme.desc: Fact-based drama, about religious fanatic Ervil LeBaron, who believed he had God's permission to kill anyone standing in the way of his drive for wealth and power. Starring Brian Dennehy, Tracy Needham and William Devane.(n)

programme.title: Crown Heights
programme.desc: Two men living in a area surrounded by racial tension between the Jewish and Black communities try to bring their divided neighbourhood together through their passion for music in the aftermath of rioting. Fact-based drama, starring Howie Mandel, Mario Van Peebles and Jeremy Blackman.(n)

programme.title: A Touch of Hope
programme.desc: A man discovers he has the abilities of a faith healer. Initially reluctant, he agrees to use his gift to help doctors, but only in emergency cases. However, many in the medical community are suspicious of his claims, a conflict that comes to a head when he is asked to bring a doubting doctor's daughter out of a coma. Fact-based drama, starring Anthony Michael Hall, CCH Pounder, Abraham Benrubi and Fay Masterson.(n)

programme.title: Her Desperate Choice
programme.desc: A woman flees the authorities in an attempt to protect her daughter from the child's paedophile father and seeks the help of an underground organisation dedicated to protecting abused youngsters. Drama, with Kyle Secor, Faith Ford, Hanna R Hall and Nigel Bennett.(n)

programme.title: Before He Wakes
programme.desc: Fact-based thriller about a greedy woman who marries and murders two wealthy husbands in succession, to acquire their fortunes, and almost succeeds in getting away scot-free. Starring Jaclyn Smith, Diana Scarwid, Hope Lange and Timothy Carhart.(n)

programme.title: Ann Rule's The Stranger Beside Me
programme.desc: An aspiring crime reporter is hired to investigate a series of grisly, unsolved murders stretching from Utah to Seattle, only to discover the killer is one of her closest friends. Fact-based thriller, starring Bill Campbell, Barbara Hershey, Kevin Dunn and Suki Kaiser.(n)

programme.title: Wicked Love
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about a woman found in a car boot after an attempt on her life that leaves her in a coma. As her unfaithful husband and his mistress stand trial, a controversy erupts over whether her life support should be switched off. Starring Rebecca Gibney, Vince Colosimo and Maya Stange.(n)

programme.title: 10th and Wolf
programme.desc: The son of a Pennsylvania mobster is determined not to follow in his father's footsteps, and instead joins the army, serving in the first gulf war. When he impulsively steals a jeep at the end of the conflict, the FBI offer him a way out of paying for his crime - go back to his old neighbourhood and infiltrate the Sicilian crime syndicate taking over the drug trade in the city. However, he soon realises his actions have placed his small time crook brother and cousin in danger. Thriller, starring James Marsden, Dennis Hopper, Giovanni Ribisi and Piper Perabo.(n)

programme.title: The Judge
programme.desc: Part one of two. A lawyer defends a controversial judge arrested for soliciting, but soon uncovers a sorry tale involving everything from death and police corruption to an over-ambitious prosecutor. Drama, starring Chris Noth, Edward James Olmos, Lolita Davidovich and Charles Durning.

programme.title: Have You Seen My Son
programme.desc: A woman strives to find her sick son after he is kidnapped by her ex-husband. Drama, starring Lisa Hartman Black, William Russ, Jameson Parker, Anne Francis and Scott Hylands.

programme.title: Mistaken Identity
programme.desc: A mix-up in a maternity ward results in two new mothers unwittingly taking home the wrong babies - leaving them to face a terrible dilemma once the truth comes to light. Drama based on a true story, starring Melissa Gilbert, Rosanna Arquette, David Andrews and James McCaffrey.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: A meteorite lands in the Baldwin sisters' recipe room, causing quite a stir among the locals who believe it to be a heaven-sent omen of hope.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: A minister comes to stay with the Waltons, but his presence soon sparks off all manner of religious ructions.

programme.title: The Disappearing Act
programme.desc: A distraught mother turns detective to find out the truth behind her son's disappearance, concerned he may have met with foul play at the hands of his beautiful but volatile girlfriend. Fact-based drama, starring Patty Duke, Kelly Rowan and Robert Floyd.

programme.title: Quest for Justice
programme.desc: A 1950s newspaper publisher battles for black integration in her hometown, which is divided by racism. Drama, starring Jane Seymour, DW Moffett, Richard Kiley, Lou Walker and Michelle Joyner.

programme.title: A Killing in a Small Town
programme.desc: A Sunday school teacher looking for excitement embarks on an affair with a church-going man, leading to a fatal confrontation with his wife - but as the case goes to trial, she realises the odds are stacked against a jury accepting her plea of self-defence. Fact-based drama, starring Barbara Hershey, Brian Dennehy, John Terry and Lee Garlington.

programme.title: No One Could Protect Her
programme.desc: A woman is raped in her own home, but the police seem powerless to apprehend the attacker. As reports of further sexual assaults in her neighbourhood mount up, all seemingly the work of the same man, she resolves to turn detective and bring him to justice herself. Thriller based on a true story, starring Joanna Kerns, Anthony John Denison and Peter MacNeill.

programme.title: First Do No Harm
programme.desc: A woman decides to seek alternative forms of treatment for her epileptic son after the conventional methods employed by his doctors fail to have an impact on his welbeing. However, she encounters resistance from members of the medical establishment, who seek to take legal action to stop her removing her child from the hospital. Drama, based on a true story, starring Meryl Streep.

programme.title: Wicked Love
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about a woman found in a car boot after an attempt on her life that leaves her in a coma. As her unfaithful husband and his mistress stand trial, a controversy erupts over whether her life support should be switched off. Starring Rebecca Gibney, Vince Colosimo and Maya Stange.

programme.title: The Christmas Choir
programme.desc: A workaholic accountant is forced to reassess his priorities after his devotion to his job costs him his girlfriend. An encounter with a homeless pianist reminds him of his forgotten dream of becoming a musician, so he decides to help the residents of a homeless shelter earn some money by forming a choir. Drama, starring Jason Gedrick and Tyrone Benskin.

programme.title: Stolen Babies
programme.desc: A welfare worker attempts to bring down a woman she believes is running an illegal adoption racket, but finds her efforts constantly thwarted by her adversary's society connections. Fact-based drama, starring Lea Thompson and Mary Tyler Moore.

programme.title: The Judge
programme.desc: Part two of two. A lawyer defends a controversial judge arrested for soliciting, but soon uncovers a sorry tale involving everything from death and police corruption to an over-ambitious prosecutor. Courtroom drama, starring Chris Noth, Edward James Olmos, Lolita Davidovich and Charles Durning.(n)

programme.title: Child of Rage
programme.desc: A priest and his wife adopt seven-year-old Catherine and her brother Eric, but quickly realise the girl's troubled past has left her suffering from violent behavioural problems. Drama, starring Mel Harris, Dwight Schultz and Ashley Peldon.(n)

programme.title: Mary Higgins Clark: Loves Music, Loves to Dance
programme.desc: A tenacious TV producer sets out to get to the bottom of a friend's murder, certain that the killer was a man her pal had met online. However, it soon becomes clear that her very personal investigation has served only to place her in danger as well. Mystery, based on Mary Higgins Clark's novel, starring Patsy Kensit, Cynthia Preston and Dean McDermott.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: The children prevent an injured orphan from killing a raccoon and take him under their wing - but soon wonder whether they have made the right decision.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John and the family are puzzled by the cold manner of their new neighbours - until it comes to light that they suffered at the hands of the Nazis and are still afraid to reveal their ancestry.(n)

programme.title: The Murder of Mary Phagan
programme.desc: Part one of two. A Jewish factory owner in 1930s Georgia is unjustly accused of murder. Despite all the evidence pointing in another direction, an ambitious prosecutor and an unscrupulous journalist whip up a frenzy of anti-semitism against the suspect. However, the state governor sees through the bigotry and does everything in his power to see justice is done. Fact-based drama, starring Jack Lemmon, Peter Gallagher, Kevin Spacey and Richard Jordan.(n)

programme.title: For the Love of a Child
programme.desc: Two inspirational women who carry out extensive work with abused, neglected and abandoned children around the world. Drama, starring Peri Gilpin, Teri Polo and Maria Del Mar.(n)

programme.title: The Return
programme.desc: A woman receives a conditional discharge from prison after serving 10 years for killing her husband in a drunken rage - an event she cannot even remember. Rebuilding her life proves easier said than done, especially when she discovers that if she tries to contact her teenage son or touches alcohol again, she will be sent back to jail. Drama, starring Julie Walters Neil Dudgeon, Ger Ryan and Pauline McLynn.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: A newcomer arrives in town looking for a job and a place to stay, but suspicions are raised that he may be a German spy.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.sub-title: There's No Place Like Home - Part One.
programme.desc: Part one of two. The Ingalls, Oleson and Garvey families get tired of the bustling city life and decide to return to Walnut Grove, where a shock awaits them.(n)

programme.title: Wife, Mother, Murderer
programme.desc: A woman desperate to escape her small town roots murders her husband, attempts to poison her child and assumes multiple fake identities, even going so far as to fake the death of one of her aliases and take on the guise of her own identical twin sister. Fact-based drama, starring Judith Light and David Ogden Stiers.(n)

programme.title: The Forget-Me-Not Murders
programme.desc: A policeman races against time to find a serial killer who leaves dried flowers next to each of his victims, and the chase becomes even more desperate when he learns that his goddaughter could be next on the murderer's list. Detective thriller, starring Richard Crenna, Tyne Daly, Cliff Gorman and Neve Campbell.(n)

programme.title: Dangerous Indiscretions
programme.desc: Kate Ricketts narrates a documentary examining the British monarchy in the aftermath of the death of Diana, Princess of Wales, and the Windsor family's assorted feuds and divorces. Featuring archive footage of Prince Charles, Sarah Ferguson and Camilla Parker-Bowles.(n)

programme.title: Edward and Sophie: The True Story
programme.desc: Documentary about Prince Edward's relationship with Sophie Rhys-Jones.(n)

programme.title: Murder of Innocence
programme.desc: A woman's descent into insanity is witnessed by her confused and alienated husband as he battles the authorities to prove she is a danger to society. Drama, starring Valerie Bertinelli and Stephen Caffrey.(n)

programme.title: Wolves
programme.desc: In this unconventional horror film, a high schooler discovers he's a werewolf after his parents are savagely murdered. He later ends up in a remote mountain town, where he meets others of his kind and fights for the love of a beautiful woman(n)

programme.title: Jamie Marks Is Dead
programme.desc: The ghost of a young loner haunts a high school track star who never knew him in life. Later, the popular athlete flees his troubled home, and has a terrifying encounter with a malevolent spirit whose motivations appear to be much darker(n)

programme.title: The Last Keepers
programme.desc: A teenage outcast discovers that - like the rest of her family - she has extraordinary powers. Family(n)

programme.title: Don't Blink
programme.desc: Ten friends are stranded at an abandoned mountain resort, and begin to disappear one by one. Later, the few who remain race to find an answer before they vanish into thin air(n)

programme.title: The Hunters
programme.desc: After the mysterious disappearance of two archeologists who retrieve fairy-tale objects, it's up to their teenage sons to step up and save the day(n)

programme.title: Space Warriors
programme.desc: Apollo 13 meets Spy Kids in this family action. Jimmy Hawkins defies his ex-astronaut dad to enter a NASA competition in the hope of winning a spot on the next space shuttle. But space camp fun takes a serious turn when the International Space Station runs into trouble and the real NASA boffins can't rescue the astronauts onboard(n)

programme.title: Exists
programme.desc: Prepare to shake with fear as Bigfoot stalks five friends during a camping trip in the East Texas wilderness(n)

programme.title: The Legend of Gator Face
programme.desc: Mischievous 12-year-olds (John White, Dan Warry-Smith) stir up their sleepy town when one masquerades as a creature that's "half-man, half-alligator" and lives in a nearby swamp. Bob: Paul Winfield. Angel: Charlotte Sullivan. Sheriff: C. David Johnson. Danny's Mom: Kathleen Laskey(n)

programme.title: The Maddening
programme.desc: A little girl and her mother find themselves the focus of a crazed couple's delusions. The horror begins after Cassie has a fight with her husband David and takes off in the car with their young daughter Samantha. Cassie takes a wrong turn and ends up in the home of the evil Mr. and Mrs. Scudder(n)

programme.title: Reeker
programme.desc: Terrifying shocker about a foul-smelling creature that raises a horrific stink in an abandoned desert town. The monster targets a quintet of young travelers who get lost. Devon Gummersall stars as the brilliant but blind leader of the pack. Written and directed by Dave Payne(n)

programme.title: Exists
programme.desc: Prepare to shake with fear as Bigfoot stalks five friends during a camping trip in the East Texas wilderness(n)

programme.title: Donovan's Echo
programme.desc: Thirty years after his wife and child perished in an accident, Donovan Matheson returns to his hometown and grows convinced that the tragedies of the past will soon repeat themselves, claiming the lives of his neighbour and her young daughter(n)

programme.title: The Giver
programme.desc: A young man living in a totalitarian society learns the true history of his community from a mysterious yet seemingly benevolent figure known as the Giver. In time, the youth finds the burden of the truth too great to bear and plots to escape(n)

programme.title: Frequencies
programme.desc: In a fantastical alternate universe, only people with the same innate frequency can be together. Despite this, a young man falls for a woman with a different frequency, and must defy the very rules of reality for his love(n)

programme.title: Dreamscape
programme.desc: In an attempt to help people who experience recurring nightmares, a research program is using psychics to enter the patients' dreams. The studies are going well, until the President of the U.S. becomes one of the patients, and a psychic assassin attempts to kill him in his sleep(n)

programme.title: Tales From the Hood
programme.desc: When a trio of young criminals break into a funeral home searching for a stash of drugs, they instead find themselves face to face with a creepy mortician, who tells them four separate stories of terror. This anthology film attempts a black-oriented, socially conscious spin on the horror genre(n)

programme.title: Reeker
programme.desc: Terrifying shocker about a foul-smelling creature that raises a horrific stink in an abandoned desert town. The monster targets a quintet of young travelers who get lost. Devon Gummersall stars as the brilliant but blind leader of the pack. Written and directed by Dave Payne(n)

programme.title: The Hunters
programme.desc: After the mysterious disappearance of two archeologists who retrieve fairy-tale objects, it's up to their teenage sons to step up and save the day(n)

programme.title: Russell Mulcahy's Tale of the Mummy
programme.desc: Chiller in the tradition of the cult Hammer Horror movies in which the curse of Talos the Mummy is unleashed, bringing death and destruction to the world as Talos seeks immortality. Horror film stalwart Christopher Lee plays the ill-fated archaeologist who first breaks the seal of the mummy's tomb(n)

programme.title: Judgment Day
programme.desc: This sci-fi thriller finds the world in imminent danger when a collision in outer space sends huge pieces of interstellar debris on a path headed straight for Earth. A scientist has designed a system that would stop the largest meteor fragments from striking the earth, but a fanatical religious cult have made it their business to stop him. A convicted murderer (Ice-T) with ties to the group must now join forces with an FBI agent (Suzy Amis) to free the scientist from the cult's clutches and prevent millions of needless deaths. Mario Van Peebles and Linden Ashby appear in supporting roles(n)

programme.title: Nightlight
programme.desc: Teens playing a spooky flashlight game in the woods at night get more than they bargained for when a demon is awakened by their shenanigans(n)

programme.title: The Death of Superman Lives: What Happened?
programme.desc: A documentary look at why the planned 1998 film "Superman Lives" was scrapped. The superhero flick would have starred Nicolas Cage as the Man of Steel and been directed by Tim Burton(n)

programme.title: Atari: Game Over
programme.desc: An exploration of the decline of video-game giant Atari and its secret burial of unsold "E.T." game cartridges in a New Mexico landfill(n)

programme.title: Intruders
programme.desc: A mysterious beast stalks innocent children in this thriller from Spanish director Juan Carlos Fresnadillo. In the 1980s, Juan (Izan Corchero) is a young boy with an active imagination and a talent for writing stories. However, he is being terrorized by a strange creature that lurks in his room late at night and doesn't seem to have a face. Juan's mother Luisa (Pilar Lopez de Ayala) is skeptical at first, but comes to believe demonic forces are at work and asks a local priest (Daniel Bruehl) to chase the spirits out. However, it soon becomes obvious Satan is not the one to blame for the horrible visits. Three decades later, John (Clive Owen) and Susanna (Carice van Houten) are the parents of Mia (Ella Purnell), a 13-year-old girl. John is fiercely protective of his daughter, and when she's attacked in her room late one night, he's determined to find whoever or whatever is responsible. As it happens, Mia is being visited by Hollowface, a monster similar to the one who was stalking Juan, and he's just as difficult to frighten away. Juan Carlos Fresnadillo's first directorial project after his commercial breakthrough with 28 Weeks Later, Intruders was an official selection at the 2011 Toronto International Film Festival(n)

programme.title: Russell Mulcahy's Tale of the Mummy
programme.desc: Chiller in the tradition of the cult Hammer Horror movies in which the curse of Talos the Mummy is unleashed, bringing death and destruction to the world as Talos seeks immortality. Horror film stalwart Christopher Lee plays the ill-fated archaeologist who first breaks the seal of the mummy's tomb(n)

programme.title: The Gift
programme.desc: Cate Blanchett stars in Sam Raimi's psychological thriller as a widow "blessed" with psychic powers. When she's asked to help investigate the brutal murder of a society girl, she uncovers a web of deceit and lies that the Georgia townsfolk hide behind. And as the investigation gathers pace, her life is increasingly placed in danger(n)

programme.title: Why Horror?
programme.desc: A horror-movie fan interviews lovers of the genre to understand why people like to be scared(n)

programme.title: The Death of Superman Lives: What Happened?
programme.desc: A documentary look at why the planned 1998 film "Superman Lives" was scrapped. The superhero flick would have starred Nicolas Cage as the Man of Steel and been directed by Tim Burton(n)

programme.title: Atari: Game Over
programme.desc: An exploration of the decline of video-game giant Atari and its secret burial of unsold "E.T." game cartridges in a New Mexico landfill(n)

programme.title: Heartless
programme.desc: A young photographer with a huge, red heart-shaped birthmark on his face learns that reptilian monsters are posing as street gangs in London. Their leader offers to remove his facial disfigurement in return for performing some evil deeds(n)

programme.title: Scar Tissue
programme.desc: A young man and a female cop hunt a serial killer who supposedly died years earlier

programme.title: Patrick
programme.desc: In this shocking remake of the terrifying cult classic, a telekinetic coma patient is subjected to cruel medical experiments by a malevolent doctor. When the outwardly brain-dead patient lashes out, a nurse becomes the target of his supernatural wrath

programme.title: The Mind of Mark Defriest
programme.desc: A profile of a talented jailbreak artist who is forced to spend time in the harshest penitentiary in Florida after a psychiatrist testified that he was faking mental illness for decades. The filmmakers explore how the legal and penal systems have treated this man

programme.title: Maz Jobrani: I'm Not a Terrorist But I've Played One on TV
programme.desc: Comedian Maz Jobrani takes on sociopolitical issues and childrearing through the lens of his Iranian-American background

programme.title: Greetings From Tim Buckley
programme.desc: Set in 1991, just three years before the release of Jeff Buckley's debut album Grace and six years before his untimely death at age 30, director Dan Algrant's Greetings From Tim Buckley follows the troubled young musician as he prepares to participate in a tribute concert for his late father while at the same time struggling to emerge from under his father's colossal shadow. As the concert at St. Ann's Church approaches, rising musician Tim (Penn Badgley) wrestles with the anger of being abandoned by his dad (who later died of a drug overdose), and starts to fall for a Allie (Imogen Poots), a pretty intern who's helping to organize the performance. Meanwhile, as Tim grapples with the complex emotions of feeling like an outsider and a guest of honor at the same time, glimpses of his father's rise and fall puts the young musician's life into a unique perspective

programme.title: 21 Years: Richard Linklater
programme.desc: This affectionate profile of indie director Richard Linklater examines his life and creative process in an attempt to explain the mind-set that brought "Dazed and Confused," "Boyhood" and the "Before Sunrise" trilogy to the big screen

programme.title: The Roost
programme.desc: Creatures of the night find new prey on the scariest night of the year in this horror story. It's Halloween night, and four friends -- Allison (Vanessa Horneff), Elliott (Wil Horneff), Trevor (Karl Jacob), and Brian (Sean Reid) -- are on a road trip en route to a friend's wedding when their car breaks down after running into something. Looking for help, the four happen upon the farmhouse of an elderly couple, Elvin (Richard Little) and May (Barbara Wilhide), which is located next to a huge barn. Elvin and May have already become lost in the darkness of the barn, and soon two of the lost travelers are suffering the same fate as they search for friendly strangers. However, while they can barely see a hand in front of their face, they discover they're not alone in the barn, which has become home to a huge swarm of bloodthirsty bats. The Roost is framed by an introduction and postscript from a television horror show host, played by Tom Noonan

programme.title: Inside Comedy
programme.desc: Conan O'Brien; Jeffrey Tambor. Season 4 ends with Conan O'Brien and Jeffrey Tambor being interviewed

programme.title: Big Significant Things
programme.desc: In this touching dramedy, a twentysomething man named Craig embarks on a road trip that could threaten his cross-country move with his girlfriend. Along the way, he visits some of the world's largest roadside attractions

programme.title: A Glimpse Inside the Mind of Charles Swan III
programme.desc: Famed graphic designer Charles Swan III (Charlie Sheen) finds his life spiraling out of control after he is dumped by his gorgeous girlfriend and becomes lost in a world of delusion and fantasy in this satirical comedy from director Roman Coppola (CQ). Charles Swan III had everything a man could want the day Ivana (Katheryn Winnick) walked out on him, yet all of his money and fame do little to heal the pain of his broken heart. Fortunately for Charles, his loyal friends Kirby (Jason Schwartzman) and Saul (Bill Murray) and his sister Izzy (Patricia Arquette) are there to help him on the road to emotional recovery. Aubrey Plaza and Mary Elizabeth Winstead co-star

programme.title: Common
programme.desc: A 17-year-old boy faces murder charges after a friend riding in his car stabs someone to death, due to a cop who uses the controversial joint-enterprise doctrine to try everyone possible for the crime

programme.desc: A demonic lumberjack terrorizes the staff of a church camp as they prepare for spring break

programme.desc: A young detective goes undercover at an elite private school to destroy an international stolen car ring(n)

programme.desc: The ghost of a young loner haunts a high school track star who never knew him in life. Later, the popular athlete flees his troubled home, and has a terrifying encounter with a malevolent spirit whose motivations appear to be much darker(n)

programme.title: Just Let Go: Lenny Kravitz Live
programme.desc: A six-month Lenny Kravitz tour from Paris to New York is chronicled and examines the relationship between him and his illustrious band, who talk candidly about life on the road, sharing the stage, improvising, translating the music from the studio and Kravitz's quest for perfection(n)

programme.desc: A look at the rock band INXS explores their rise to fame, worldwide success and the death of lead singer Michael Hutchence(n)

programme.desc: A look at the rock band INXS explores their rise to fame, worldwide success and the death of lead singer Michael Hutchence(n)

programme.title: Leave the World Behind
programme.desc: Electronic muisc group Swedish House Mafia embark on their "One Last Tour" world tour(n)

programme.title: Frank Miller's Sin City: A Dame to Kill For
programme.desc: The follow-up to the comic miniseries adaptation tells Dwight's backstory as he becomes wrapped up in the thralls of femme fatale, Ava. Elsewhere in the seedy city, a mysterious gambler is set on taking down his sworn enemy in a high-stakes game of life and death(n)

programme.title: Lucky Number Slevin
programme.desc: Paul McGuigan's tricksy thriller stars Josh Hartnett as Slevin Kelevra, who pitches up at his friend's New York apartment, only to find it empty. He makes himself at home, but his peace is interrupted by employees of crime lord The Boss, who mistake him for his absent friend, who owes The Boss $96,000. But The Boss makes Slevin an offer: kill the son of his rival, The Rabbi, and the debt will be wiped clean. But The Rabbi soon gets hold of Slevin and makes a counter-offer. Add in cynical assassin Mr Goodkat, who is playing both ends against the middle in what might be a long-term plan, and Lucy Liu as Lindsey, Slevin's next-door neighbour, who soon becomes his love interest, and the result is a multi-stranded double-cross, but one with only one lucky winner..

programme.title: War
programme.desc: Jet Li and Jason Statham star in this fast paced action thriller, directed by Phillip G. Atwell. Statham plays an FBI agent determined to take down a mysterious assassin known as Rogue (Li), after his partner is murdered

programme.title: Arachnophobia
programme.desc: Heart-stopping horror yarn in which a doctor, Ross Jennings, moves his family to a new town only to find his patients falling victim to the offspring of a deadly tropical variety of the very creature he loathes - the spider. Fear grips the doctor's heart when it dawns on him that the South American spiders causing the deaths are nesting in his barn, and it falls upon him to save the otherwise safe and placid small town

programme.title: Lost Songs: The Basement Tapes Continued
programme.desc: Modern country and folk singers adapt the recently discovered "Basement Tapes", a collection of legendary Bob Dylan sessions, into new arrangements. Lead by T Bone Burnett, this extraordinary collection of musicians include Elvis Costello, Taylor Goldsmith, Jim James, and more

programme.title: Arctic Tale
programme.desc: Documentary following the life cycle of a plucky newborn polar bear and a walrus cub

programme.title: Meru
programme.desc: This documentary follows top climbers Conrad Anker, Jimmy Chin and Renan Ozturk as they tackle the Shark's Fin, a treacherous 20,000 ft. near vertical point on Mount Meru in India. The ascent took much longer than they anticipated and the group was faced with challenging situations that included sub-zero temperatures, losing a large portion of their food and resting in sleeping bags that dangled precariously from the mountain. The group persevered and became the first team to reach the summit in October 2008. The film also contains an interview with John Krakauer, author of "Into Thin Air" and candid interviews with the climbers and their families

programme.title: Paddington
programme.desc: A little lost bear befriends a young boy at London's Paddington train station, in this live-action family film based on the children's book series by Michael Bond

programme.title: The Drew
programme.desc: The story of the unlikely rise of the Drew League from humble beginnings in the crime and gang-infested streets of South Central Los Angeles to the nation's foremost pro-am basketball league. Featuring NBA stars Kevin Durant, DeMar DeRozan, Brandon Jennings and Baron Davis

programme.title: Camp X-Ray
programme.desc: A small-town girl (Kristen Stewart) joins the military and ends up becoming a guard at Guantanamo Bay, where she begins to forge a delicate, transformative bond with an inmate (Payman Maadi) who raises some compelling questions about his incarceration

programme.title: As I AM: The Life and Times of DJ AM
programme.desc: Profiling DJ AM (aka Adam Goldstein), a hugely successful and influential disc jockey known for his mash-ups of popular songs. The film traces the course of his life as he found fame and fought to remain sober, only to relapse and die of a drug overdose at the age of 36 following the trauma of surviving a plane crash

programme.title: The Forger
programme.desc: A paroled thief gets sucked into an audacious heist scheme to steal a Monet painting by replacing it with a perfect duplicate

programme.desc: A little lost bear befriends a young boy at London's Paddington train station, in this live-action family film based on the children's book series by Michael Bond

The film traces the course of his life as he found fame and fought to remain sober, only to relapse and die of a drug overdose at the age of 36 following the trauma of surviving a plane crash

programme.title: Wild Bill
programme.desc: This film is the tale of how Wild Bill Hickok finally got his in Deadwood, but director Walter Hill tells the story in an unapologetically realistic fashion, laying to waste the glamourous legend of Wild Bill. Hill presents to the audience a stubborn, half-blind, drug-addicted Hickok who is harder to like. Terrific performances from everyone on board, especially David Arquette who is a standout(n)

programme.title: Hannibal
programme.desc: Cunning Hannibal Lecter resurfaces after a decade in hiding to toy with FBI agent Clarice Starling in this handsomely-mounted sequel. As Starling's career flounders, Lecter attempts to elude a greedy Italian police detective. Meanwhile, a maimed former victim of Lecter's plots revenge(n)

programme.title: Free Money
programme.desc: The Swede is a prison warden who rules his family and his prison with an iron hand in one of the coldest parts of North Dakota. When an inmate dies under mysterious circumstances, the FBI sends in agent Karen Polarski to investigate. On the home front, the sons-in-law of the Swede, Larry and Bud accidentally discover that a train loaded with millions of dollars of unmarked currency slated to be destroyed will soon be passing through. The temptation is too great and the guys hatch a scheme to rob the train. Of course, the biggest obstacle in their way is the Swede…(n)

programme.desc: Comedian Maz Jobrani takes on sociopolitical issues and childrearing through the lens of his Iranian-American background(n)

programme.desc: Larry the Cable Guy "gits-r-done" in this uproarious comedy about three lame-brained Army reservists who get shipped off to Iraq, but somehow wind up in the Mexican desert. Bill Engvall, DJ Qualls, Danny Trejo. Directed by C.B. Harding(n)

programme.title: Hot Rod
programme.desc: Wannabe stuntman Rod sets up a lethal motorbike jump to raise money for his stepdad's heart operation. Nerdy slapstick comedy(n)

programme.title: Exorcismus
programme.desc: A fiercely independent 15-year-old girl falls under supernatural attack in this harrowing horror film from Spain. When Emma Hawkins begins to suffer from involuntary fits, her parents begin to fear that she has a serious medical problem. Though their concerns are initially eased following a series of rigorous physical and psychological tests, it soon becomes obvious that something horrible is stirring deep inside of Emma's soul. No doctor can help Emma now, and in order to purge the blackness within, her parents must turn to a healer with the power of God on their side(n)

programme.title: Dirty Weekend
programme.desc: In this kinky comedy-drama, business colleagues Les and Natalie are stuck in Albuquerque during a long layover. While Natalie considers cheating on her partner, Les decides to investigate a drunken affair he had the last time he was in the city(n)

programme.desc: Provoke. A look at the world of Cyberbanging where inner city youth use social media to brag, conspire and incite violence. Also: two African-American women bloggers who turned the table on the trolls who threatened them; and the creator of Abdullah X, an online character who is trying to keep Muslim kids from falling under the spell of Islamic extremists

programme.title: Penn & Teller: Bull!
programme.desc: Lawns. The guys tread on unfamiliar turf when they examine the lawn-care industry. Included: the case of a man who was sent to prison because of his unkempt property; a visit to a neighborhood where only a certain strain of grass is acceptable

programme.title: The Talented Mr. Ripley
programme.desc: Matt Damon, Jude Law and Gwyneth Paltrow star in this chilling adaptation of Patricia Highsmith's novel about a social-climbing psychopath. Damon is superb as Tom Ripley, a charming mimic whose obsession with a wealthy playboy (Law) turns deadly. Cate Blanchett, Philip Seymour Hoffman. Directed by Anthony Minghella

programme.title: Hidalgo
programme.desc: Viggo Mortensen ("Lord of the Rings") and his scrappy American mustang take on Arabian purebreds in this rousing saga. Mortensen plays legendary endurance rider Frank T. Hopkins, who takes his horse Hidalgo to Arabia to race against steeds owned by proud desert royalty

programme.title: Chappie
programme.desc: Engineer Dev Patel reprograms a police droid so it can think and feel, but there are dangerous consequences. Sci-fi action with Hugh Jackman and Sigourney Weaver. (2015)(116 mins)

programme.title: Southpaw
programme.desc: Jake Gyllenhaal stars as troubled boxer Billy Hope in this high-stakes drama from director Antoine Fuqua and Sons of Anarachy creator Kurt Sutter. At the height of his fame and success, Hope is convinced by his loving wife Maureen (Rachel McAdams) to retire from the sport in order to spend more time with the couple's daughter Leila (Oona Laurence). On the night of his retirement announcement, a rival boxer calls out Hope and an altercation breaks out, killing Maureen. Hope's self-destructive behavior worsens, and Leila is taken away by child services. In order to redeem his life and get his daughter back, Hope must return to boxing under the tutelage of hardened trainer Titus "Tick" Willis (Forest Whitaker)

programme.title: Need for Speed
programme.desc: A street racer who was framed for murder leaves prison and enters a high-stakes cross-country race looking for redemption and revenge

programme.title: Ironclad
programme.desc: Vengeful King John lays siege to a castle manned by a ragtag group who are forced to make a desperate stand against the tyrant

programme.title: The Usual Suspects
programme.desc: Near the end of The Usual Suspects, Kevin Spacey, in his Oscar-winning performance as crippled con man Roger "Verbal" Kint, says, "The greatest trick the Devil ever pulled was convincing the world he didn't exist." This may be the key line in this story; the farther along the movie goes, the more one realizes that not everything is quite what it seems, and what began as a conventional whodunit turns into something quite different. A massive explosion rips through a ship in a San Pedro, CA, harbor, leaving 27 men dead, the lone survivor horribly burned, and 91 million dollars' worth of cocaine, believed to be on board, mysteriously missing. Police detective Dave Kujan (Chazz Palminteri) soon brings in the only witness and key suspect, "Verbal" Kint. Kint's nickname stems from his inability to keep his mouth shut, and he recounts the events that led to the disaster. Five days earlier, a truckload of gun parts was hijacked in Queens, NY, and five men were brought in as suspects: Kint, hot-headed hipster thief McManus (Stephen Baldwin), ill-tempered thug Hockney (Kevin Pollak), flashy wise guy Fenster (Benicio Del Toro), and Keaton (Gabriel Byrne), a cop gone bad now trying to go straight in the restaurant business. While in stir, someone suggests that they should pull a job together, and Kint hatches a plan for a simple and lucrative jewel heist. Despite Keaton's misgivings, the five men pull off the robbery without a hitch and fly to Los Angeles to fence the loot. Their customer asks if they'd be interested in pulling a quick job while out West; the men agree, but the robbery goes horribly wrong and they soon find themselves visited by Kobayashi (Pete Postlethwaite), who represents a criminal mastermind named Keyser Soze. Soze's violent reputation is so infamous that he's said to have responded to a threat to murder his family by killing them himself, just to prove that he feared no one. When Kobayashi passes along a heist proposed by Soze that sounds like suicide, the men feel that they have little choice but to agree

programme.title: Last Knights
programme.desc: In this action-packed medieval tale, a skilled warrior and his small clan fight back against an oppressive ruler in order to avenge the murder of their master

programme.title: Lucky Number Slevin
programme.desc: An innocent man visiting a friend in New York City becomes embroiled in a dangerous series of events after being mistaken for the very man he has come to the city to see in director Paul McGuigan's labyrinthine murder mystery. Upon arriving at the empty apartment of his old friend Nick, the unassuming Slevin (Josh Hartnett) is troubled to hear the voice of his missing friend's next door neighbor Lindsay (Lucy Liu) expressing concern as to Nick's safety and whereabouts. When Slevin ventures into Lindsay's apartment only to be greeted by the uninviting fist of a thuggish mob henchman, he quickly realizes that Nick is indeed in grave danger. Soon summoned by the big boss and accused of being the deeply indebted Nick, Slevin's attempts to prove his identity are foiled by the fact that his wallet had been stolen upon arrival in the city. With time running out and a complex plot to assassinate one of the city's most powerful crime bosses slowly coming into focus, the arrival of a notorious hit-man named Mr. Goodkat (Bruce Willis) forces Slevin to step up his desperate search and reclaim his identity before he's forced to pay a debt that could cost him his life(n)

programme.title: Stretch and Bobbito: Radio That Changed Lives
programme.desc: Popular '90s hip-hop DJs Stretch and Bobbito are profiled in this documentary(n)

programme.title: 11 Blocks
programme.desc: A man must fight gangs and a hitman to stay alive after being evicted from his home in this heart-pounding action thriller.(n)

programme.desc: A look at Lance Armstrong's doping scandal includes interviews with his former teammates, friends and enemies(n)

programme.desc: This entertaining documentary profiles two baseball pitchers who have managed to master the unpredictable and difficult-to-control knuckleball: Tim Wakefield and R.A. Dickey(n)

programme.title: Holy Man
programme.desc: Jeff Goldblum plays Ricky Hayman, whose boss gives him just two weeks to turn his failing shopping cable channel around. But nothing Hayman or Ivy League graduate Kate Newell do can increase viewing figures or sales, until, following a car crash, they meet 'G', an enigmatic holy man, whose wisdom and insight change the channel's fortunes and their lives(n)

programme.title: The Way of the Gun
programme.desc: Ryan Phillippe and Benicio Del Toro star as a pair of criminals who kidnap a woman pregnant with the surrogate child of a millionaire, who just happens to have a small army of armed guards and a salty hit man at his disposal. James Caan, Taye Diggs, Juliette Lewis, Scott Wilson(n)

programme.title: Iverson
programme.desc: An in-depth documentary on the career and legacy of 11-time NBA All-Star Allen Iverson, who rejected NBA convention and embraced hip-hop culture. The film examines his troubled youth, his years at Georgetown and his career with the Philadelphia 76ers. Included: interviews with Dwyane Wade, Tom Brokaw, John Thompson and Larry Brown(n)

programme.title: Spring Broke
programme.desc: The raucous history of the infamous spring break revelries in Daytona Beach, Fla., that began in the early 1960s is chronicled(n)

programme.title: Shaft
programme.desc: A slick, trigger-happy detective flouts the law as he goes on the hunt for a rich murderer whose power and influence could get him off the hook. Crime thriller(n)

programme.title: Brad Williams: Daddy Issues

programme.title: War

FBI sgent Jack Crawford (Jason Statham) is a man driven by vengeance. After his partner, Tom Lone (Terry Chen), and his family fell to bullets fired by infamous hitman Rogue (Jet Li), Crawford makes it his life mission to ferret out the slippery killer. Complications arise when it begins to appear as if Rogue has a mission of his own to carry out, and as triad boss Chang (John Lone) prepares for all-out war against yakuza boss Shiro (Ryo Ishibashi), Crawford and Rogue also come face to face as the secrets of the past emerge in a hail of gunfire(n)

programme.title: Ginger & Rosa
programme.desc: Rebellious London teens Ginger and Rosa find their friendship tested against the backdrop of the Cuban Missile Crisis in this period drama from writer/director Sally Potter (Yes, Rage). The year is 1962. As the international dispute between the Soviet Union and the U.S. threatens to cast a shadow over the entire world, Ginger (Elle Fanning) seeks solace in the arts as Rosa (Alice Englert) favors such distractions as cigarettes and boys. Meanwhile, as the bond between the two girls is strengthened by their shared disdain for their respective mothers, Ginger's free-spirited father Roland (Alessandro Nivola) encourages his daughter to protest while sparking a twinkle in the eye of smitten Rosa. But for Ginger, the pain of her parents' breakup becomes too much to endure, eventually driving her into the company of a compassionate gay couple (Timothy Spall andOliver Platt) and their good friend Bella (Annette Bening), a poet. As the future of mankind begins to look increasingly grim, Ginger and Rosa both realize that the days of their friendship might be numbered whether the world ends in nuclear annihilation or life continues on as usual(n)

programme.title: Candles on Bay Street
programme.desc: Based on the 1999 bestseller by K.C. McKinnon, this touching Hallmark Hall of Fame presentation stars Alicia Silverstone as Dee Dee, a single mom and professional candlemaker who returns to her Maine hometown after a lengthy absence. Having left town with a somewhat sullied reputation, she returns with apparently the best of intentions--bringing her 12-year-old son Trooper (Matthew Knight) along for the sentimental journey. Dee Dee's reappearance is initially met with hostility by veterinarian Lydia, whose husband (and coworker) Sam had once been Dee Dee's sweetheart. Ultimately, however, Lydia warms up to both her "rival" and her son--just before Dee Dee poignantly reveals the real reason for her unexpected homecoming. Filmed for television on location in Nova Scotia, Candles on Bay Street was first broadcast by CBS on November 26, 2006(n)

programme.title: Magic of Ordinary Days
programme.desc: Adapted from the story by Ann Howard Creel, this Hallmark Hall of Fame presentation is set in rural Colorado in 1944. After she becomes pregnant by a departing soldier, Livy Dune, the wealthy, pampered daughter of a Denver minister (Daryl Shuttleworth), is forced to forever abandon her hopes of becoming an archeologist. To shield her from further scandal, Livy's father ships her off to a remote farm and arranges her marriage with shy farmer Ray Singleton (Skeet Ulrich), who is struggling to live up to his proscribed responsibilities to the wartime government. Clearly depressed by the situation, Livy does as well as she can to be polite and civil to her husband and his sister Martha (Mare Winningham), but it is clear that she'd rather be dead than married to a man she doesn't even know. For Ray's part, he is unfailingly generous and supplicative, but the realization that Livy doesn't want him makes him feel more inadequate than ever. With almost painful slowness, the two lost souls finally come to love and cherish one another, while each one also learns to forgive themselves for their own imagined shortcomings. A subplot involves the couple's relationship with a brace of well-educated Japanese girls living in a local internment camp. The Magic of Ordinary Days made its CBS debut on January 30, 2005(n)

programme.title: Non-Stop
programme.desc: Liam Neeson reunites with Unknown director Jaume Collet-Serra) for this airborne thriller about an Air Marshal racing to stop the villain who has framed him as a hijacker during a non-stop flight from New York to London. From the moment we first meet Air Marshal Bill Marks (Neeson), it's apparent his nerves are frayed. After furtively knocking back a stiff drink in the airport parking lot, he enters the crowded terminal to board a plane bound for London. Carefully observing his fellow travelers along the way, Marks eventually ends up seated next to nervous flyer Jen (Julianne Moore), who begins to breathe easier once she's seated near a window. Later, as the plane hits cruising altitude, Marks receives a mysterious text message stating that a passenger on the flight will be killed every 20 minutes unless $150 million is deposited into a secure bank account. But the harder Marks works to identify a suspect, the deeper he implicates himself in what becomes a deadly hostage crisis unfolding at 30,000 feet over the Atlantic Ocean. When it's revealed that the account for the ransom money is in Marks' name, the FAA revokes his marshal status and the media paints him as a hijacker. As the frightened passengers begin to turn on Marks, he suspects the true culprit may not even be on the plane. And with the help of Jen and perceptive airline hostess Nancy (Michelle Dockery), he attempts to clear his name and protect the passengers by any means possible(n)

Written and directed by Joe Carnahan

programme.title: Michigan vs. Ohio State: The Rivalry
programme.desc: For over a century, The Michigan Wolverines and the Ohio State Buckeyes have been doing battle on the college gridiron. This documentary traces the rich history of this storied rivalry, underlining the importance it plays to both schools, and profiles some the games' legendary figures including Woody Hayes and Bo Schembechler

programme.title: Breach
programme.desc: Shattered Glass director Billy Ray directs Chris Cooper and Ryan Philippe in this fact-based drama concerning the FBI traitor who carried out what many historians refer to as the most notable national security breach in U.S. history. A key member of the FBI's elite Soviet Analytical Unit, Robert Hanssen (Chris Cooper) would, for 15 years beginning in 1985, sell thousands of pages of classified documents to the Soviets. After making roughly 600,000 dollars on his clandestine endeavor and compromising everything from the identities of KGB spies working for the American government to nuclear war contingency plans, Hanssen was eventually transferred to a newly created position at the FBI's Washington headquarters and assigned the task of guarding his country's most sensitive secrets. It was while working in this capacity that a young agent named Eric O'Neill (Phillipe) was assigned the task of keeping tabs on Hanssen by suspicious higher-ups. Later, after being arrested while delivering a cache of secret documents to a "dead drop" spot in a Virginia park, the notorious traitor was arrested and sentenced to life in prison with no chance for parole

programme.title: The Divergent Series: Insurgent
programme.desc: Directed by Robert Schwentke, the second film in the Divergent series find Tris (Shailene Woodley) and Four (Theo James) on the run from Jeanine Matthews (Kate Winslet) while trying to figure out the secret that will help the rebels build a new and better future

programme.title: The Transporter
programme.desc: Frank Martin will transport everything - for a price. Ice cool under pressure and a brilliant driver, he makes only one mistake: opening a wriggling package to reveal a kidnapped Chinese girl

programme.title: Real Sports With Bryant Gumbel
programme.desc: Segments include a one-on-one interview with Arizona Cardinals head coach Bruce Arians; a report on mental competitions for youth in the U.S.; and another visit with long-lost sisters Dominique Moceanu and Jen Bricker

programme.title: The Martian
programme.desc: After an exploratory mission goes awry, lone astronaut Mark Watney (Matt Damon) is left for dead on the hostile surface of Mars and must use his scientific ingenuity to homestead an enclosed habitat where he can survive. Meanwhile, the astronauts he left behind realize the severity of his plight and join forces with an international coalition of scientists to launch a rescue mission in defiance of NASA protocol

programme.title: A Walk Among the Tombstones
programme.desc: A heroin trafficker whose wife was abducted and murdered hires a haunted private investigator to track down the men who killed her in this brooding crime drama starring Liam Neeson. Matt Scudder (Neeson) was an NYPD cop having a quiet drink in a Washington Heights bar when a pair of armed robbers came in guns blazing. Giving chase, Scudder kills the robbers in the street, though a stray bullet turns a heroic moment tragic. Devastated, Scudder subsequently goes to work as an unlicensed private detective, working just outside of the law and surviving on generous gifts offered in exchange for his services. Now, tasked with rooting out the sadistic thugs who brutally murdered the wife of a wealthy drug dealer (Dan Stevens), Scudder scours the bars and back alleys of New York City in search of his elusive targets -- and the closer he gets, the more apparent it becomes that they are something much more sinister than your typical kidnappers(n)
